posts.name: Steven Carmain
posts.cooked: Title says it all.  How do you guys deal with the constantly changing simgui files in Git?  Do you suppress them, find a way to make it read only?  Make a default keybinding so that everything works?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: The default .gitignore ignores *-window.json.  Are there other files which you’re seeing as modified all the time?

posts.name: Davo
posts.cooked: There’s simgui.json and simgui-ds.json too. I’m not sure how often they change though, since I have those in gitignore too.

posts.name: Steven Carmain
posts.cooked:
So, simgui.json changes if anyone moves a window around or changes a feature (by design).  simgui-ds.json changes when a new joystick is plugged in, the controller changes to keyboard, or a keybinding is changed (by design).

Basically, whenever someone runs the simulation, these files change almost every time.  We have checked in 4 revisions of both these files so far, and that’s with the kids knowing don’t check it in, as they aren’t really “relevant” to their changes.

I guess, would it be possible to change the simulation to only save these json files when the user hits save instead of autoupdating the files every run?  (also, can you change the simulation so it doesn’t pop open the window for “SIM GUI” and “Use Driver Station” every run that we have to hit enter for, and just have those settings somewhere? (like .wpilib/wpilib_preferences.json or build.gradle))

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
Steven_Carmain:

moves a window around

That should only affect simgui-window.json.  Other settings are saved in the main json.

Some people do want these things to be checked in and show up across different computers.  If you don’t want them to, adding them to gitignore will prevent them from being checked in.

Steven_Carmain:

would it be possible to change the simulation to only save these json files when the user hits save instead of autoupdating the files

This was a deliberate design decision for simulation, as sim is often highly iterative (eg quit sim, make a code tweak, rerun sim, and it “picks up where you left off” visually with no extra steps).

Steven_Carmain:

can you change the simulation so it doesn’t pop open the window for “SIM GUI” and “Use Driver Station” every run that we have to hit enter for, and just have those settings somewhere?

You can change the defaults for what’s checked and what’s not in build.gradle.  I know we disable that popup completely for Romi projects so it should be straightforward to make doing so an option for normal robot programs as well—feel free to open an issue on GitHub.

Related issue for us: The simgui.json file contains an entry

which holds the absolute path to the field image.

On a Mac that would be like /Users/Fred/git/FRC2023/field.png , on Windows it would be C:\\Users\\Jane\\git\\FRC2023\\field.png . So both the format and the user are different when you have several people work on the software. Is there a way to have a common “relative” name for the field, like just “field.png” which then works for everybody?

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
Peter_Johnson:

You can change the defaults for what’s checked and what’s not in build.gradle. I know we disable that popup completely for Romi projects so it should be straightforward to make doing so an option for normal robot programs as well

In File → Preferences → Settings navigate to Extensions → WPILib Extension and then set WPILib: Skip Select Simulate Extension

/foo.jpg should just work

Thanks, works indeed! Turns out paths relative to the project folder like images/field.png work as well, using the forward-slash syntax, on both Windows and Mac

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
